verses.name: 1 Timothy 6:4
verses.text: He is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,

verses.name: 1 Timothy 6:5
verses.text: Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.

verses.name: 1 Timothy 6:6
verses.text: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

verses.name: 1 Timothy 6:7
verses.text: For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out.

verses.name: 1 Timothy 6:8
verses.text: And having food and raiment let us be therewith content.

verses.name: 1 Timothy 6:9
verses.text: But they that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many foolish and hurtful lusts, which drown men in destruction and perdition.
